name: SINcerely Yours Online Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which word means "A plaster or poultice composed principally of powdered mustard seed, or containing the volatile oil of mustard seed"?
questions.explanation:
sinapism.

	Sincipita means forehead.Sinecure means any office or position which requires or involves little or no responsibility, labor, or active service.Sinew means either a tendon or to knit together.

sincere.

	Sin is any act against God.Sine is a mathematical term meaning the length of a perpendicular drawn from one extremity of an arc of a circle to the diameter drawn through the other extremity.Sinfonia means a symphony.

questions.text: What word means a small symphony?
questions.explanation:
sinfonietta.

	Singed is the past tense of singe.Singlet is an unlined waistcoat.Singleton is a card playing term.

questions.text: Which word is a horse related term meaning: The pivoted or swinging bar to which the traces of a harnessed horse are fixed?
questions.explanation:
singletree.

	Singlets are unlined waistcoats.To singularize means to make single or diminish.Sinistral means related to the left.

questions.text: Which word can mean either being on the left side, or wrong?
questions.explanation:
sinistrous.

	A sink is either an item used to wash up, or as a verb it also means to go under.A sinker is something or someone that sinks, a weight such as on a fishing line, or a part of a sewing machine. Sinless means perfect; without sin.

questions.text: What word means relating to the Chinese language or Chinese literature?
questions.explanation:
sinological.

	A sinologue is a student of Chinese. Sinology is the study of Chinese (both culture and the actual language).Sinopia is a red ocher.

questions.text: What word refers to marijuana with high levels of THC?
questions.explanation:
sinsemilla.

	Sinsyne is of Scottish origin and means from that time.Sinter means dross, as of iron.Sinning is the process of committing sin.

questions.text: What word means to bend in and out?
questions.explanation:
sinuate.

	Sinuosity is a bend or curve.Sinus is a cavity (found in the face around the nose).Sinusitis is the inflammation of the sinuses.

questions.text: What word means a curve of sines?
questions.explanation:
sinusoid.

	Sins is the plural of sin.Since means from the time of.Sincerest means the most sincere.

questions.text: Which word means resembling a tendon?
questions.explanation:
sinewy.

	Sinful means full of sin.Singularly means extraordinarily.A sinkhole is a depressed area in which waste or drainage collects.
